result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

records.addlTxt: Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.

8:30 AM Attorney Matthew W. Giesfeldt in court for Tyyon R Bell.  Attorney Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyyon R Bell not in court. Atty. Giesfeldt states DE is at WMH and not available for preliminary hearing, raises competency. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits, finds PC to proceed with competency evaluation and orders evaluation.

Defendant Tyyon R Bell in court.  Attorney Matthew W. Giesfeldt in court for Tyyon R Bell.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. State is not ready to proceed; officer is not available. Objection by Atty Giesfeldt. objects. Court finds good cause to set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use 9-1-1 except only for bona fide emergencies. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any law enforcement officer listed int he Complaint. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of firearm.

1:40 PM Defendant Tyyon R Bell in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD eligible but no one has been appointed as of today.   CT finds good cause to extend time limits.    DE argued with prosecutor and court and used vulgar language.

3:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyyon R Bell in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Tyyon R Bell. Arguments by parties.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Tyyon R Bell not in court.  ADA Frank Remington appeared for ADA Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests bench warrant; granted
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not use 9-1-1 except only for bona fide emergencies. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any law enforcement officer listed int he Complaint. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of firearm. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

09:08 AM Defendant appeared.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
